channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Seeing Greene: Exiting Bad Deals, Going Over Budget, & the BEST First Rental
item.description: Every investor would love some extra cash flow…but at what cost? Does it make sense to go all in on a large down payment so that more money trickles in […]

item.title: Firefox now lets you choose your preferred AI chatbot in its Nightly builds
item.description: As browsers continue to add AI features into their products, Mozilla is looking give users some choice in the matter. The company announced on Tuesday that it’s launching an opt-in experiment offering access to different AI services in Nightly, the experimental version of Firefox. The company plans to improve the experience before bringing it to […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: A Death Row Prisoner’s Parting Interview
item.description: Days before his scheduled execution in Texas, Ramiro Gonzales speaks on faith, legacy — and apologizing to the family of his victim, Bridget Townsend.

item.title: Federal Experts Talk Bird Flu ‘What Ifs’ in WebMD Live Event
item.description: WebMD brought together experts from four federal agencies to talk prevention, monitoring, and what the “what ifs” of bird flu might look like.

item.title: Renting vs. Buying a Home in 2024 and Do You Have Enough in Your 401(k)?
item.description: Renting vs. buying a house: when it comes to FIRE, many people assume that you must own a home and preferably have it paid off to reach financial freedom. But […]

item.title: Circular will pay competitor Oura royalties to sell its smart ring in the US
item.description: Smart ring makers Oura and Circular Tuesday announced a settlement in an ongoing patent suit. The agreed-upon terms find the French company entering into a multi-year agreement with Oura, wherein it will license the market leader’s intellectual property for devices sold in the U.S. Financial details of the agreement have been kept confidential. Oura has […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The New Battle Over an Old Institution: Forced Prison Labor
item.description: Inside the latest legal and legislative efforts to close state constitutional loopholes that allow slavery as punishment for a crime.

item.title: What’s Next in Health Care for Older Adults: Questions and Answers With John Whyte, MD
item.description: As WebMD’s chief medical officer, John Whyte, MD, is in a unique position to see both the current state of medical care for America’s older adults and the way things are trending for the future. We asked him to share his insight on a few topics, along with a bit of advice.

item.title: The 4 Freedoms for the Perfect Life and How to Create Each
item.description: We all want these four basic freedoms in some way. Here's how to earn them.

item.title: Inspired by Gen Z, Pinterest users can now turn boards into videos for sharing on Instagram and TikTok
item.description: The new addition was inspired by the video-sharing activity that was already taking place on apps like TikTok. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Mississippi Wants to Allow Some Votes From Jails and Prisons. Red Tape May Stop It.
item.description: A new state law will allow more people in jails and prisons to cast absentee ballots, but many obstacles remain.

item.title: Get the Care You Need in a COVID-19 World
item.description: What to expect at the doctor’s office, hospitals, and long-term care facilities, the future of telemedicine, and how to get the best care during COVID-19.

item.title: “Housing Cartel” Investigated by the DOJ Puts Landlords on Alert
item.description: RealPage has been accused of price fixing in Atlanta, bringing the DOJ into housing affairs.

item.title: Stability AI lands a lifeline from Sean Parker, Greycroft
item.description: Stability AI, the beleaguered generative AI startup behind Stable Diffusion, has raised new cash. But it won’t reveal how much. Greycroft, Coatue Management, Sound Ventures, Lightspeed Venture Partners, O’Shaughnessy Ventures and angel investors Prem Akkaraju, Napster founder Sean Parker, Eric Schmidt and Robert Nelsen have injected fresh capital into Stability, the company revealed Tuesday morning […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The Minneapolis Cop Who Beat Him Pleaded Guilty. He Still Fears the Department Won’t Change.
item.description: Jaleel Stallings was swept up in the chaos of protests over George Floyd’s murder. The outcome changed his life.

item.title: Personal Shopper: A Savvy Black Entrepreneur Guides You to Eczema-Friendly Clothes, Creams, Cosmetics, and More
item.description: A savvy black entrepreneur guides you on an eczema-friendly shopping spree.

item.title: Is California’s ADU Law the Beginning of a New Era in Housing?
item.description: San Jose is the first city to embrace AB 1033 as ADUs become a potential solution to affordability.

item.title: Internet goes dark in Kenya in the wake of major protests over finance bill
item.description: London-based internet rights monitoring group NetBlocks has reported a major internet disruption in Kenya following a wave of demonstrations across the country, as police violently cracked down on citizens taking to the streets to protest a government bill to hike taxes despite tough economic times and widespread corruption. The interruption in access comes as the […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: More States Restricting ‘Excited Delirium’ as Cause of Death in Police Custody
item.description: Authorities use the term to describe the condition of some people who die. But some medical organizations say it’s useless or racist pseudoscience.

item.title: Behind the Spike in Colorectal Cancer Among Young Americans
item.description: Colorectal cancer cases increased a whopping 333% among 15- to 19-year-olds and 185% among 20- to 24-year-olds from 1999 to 2020.
